title: Fort Pulaski National Monument: Park Home
body: A Turning Point in Military History  For much of the 19th century, masonry fortifications were the United Statesâ€™ main defense against overseas enemies. However, during the Civil War, new technology proved its superiority to these forts. The Union army used rifled cannon and compelled the Confederate garrison inside Fort Pulaski to surrender. The siege was a landmark experiment in the history of military science and invention              Founder's Day at Fort Pulaski   Come celebrate the National Park Service Centennial with us on August 25, 2016.
